ResearchProjectDef.label: sand support tiles
ResearchProjectDef.description: Special tiles, pilons and girders, placed on top of sand to support heavier structures.

ResearchProjectDef.label: sand support tiles (material-surfaced)
ResearchProjectDef.description: Surface sand support tiles with an additional material, for decorative or functional purposes.

ResearchProjectDef.label: soft sand support tiles
ResearchProjectDef.description: Building on top of soft sand, requires even more specialized knowledge and construction techniques.

ResearchProjectDef.label: concrete sand
ResearchProjectDef.description: Polymerize sand into a form of concrete, to lock the sand in place and keep it from dirtying other surfaces.

ResearchProjectDef.label: soft concrete sand
ResearchProjectDef.description: Building with soft sand requires even more skill and knowledge than coarse sand, but can be used to produce more pleasant-looking items.

ResearchProjectDef.label: concrete sand wall
ResearchProjectDef.description: Pour concrete sand into a rough wall.

ResearchProjectDef.label: concrete sand bedding
ResearchProjectDef.description: Pour concrete sand into roughly-shaped beds. Cleaner than sleeping on the floor, but ugly and uncomfortable.

ResearchProjectDef.label: concrete sand art
ResearchProjectDef.description: Concrete made from soft sand can be used to produce pleasant-looking art installations. While not as pleasing as other materials, it might be all that's available in harsh environments.
